answers.author: Amanda Relyea
answers.text:
We are currently researching the possibility of entering into an agreement with a professional resume firm. If we are able to strike a deal, we are not sure if that agreement will provide free resume services to members in transition, discounts for all ICMA members, or something else. 
In the meantime, you can find some helpful resume tips in the Job Loss topic on the Knowledge Network, or one of the Range Riders from Florida may be able to provide you with feedback on your current resume or put you in touch with someone who can (see http://webapps.icma.org/rosters/index.cfm?roster=RR for a Range Rider roster). You may also feel free to forward your resume to me at arelyea@icma.org. I am not a certified professional resume writer, but am a certified editor and have a little experience helping people with their resumes and cover letters.

answers.author: Robert Carty
answers.text:
You might also explore the Career Coaching group, there are some executive recruiters and other members with that skillset who could assist a fellow ICMA member until we get something more formal launched. Also, the Cal-ICMA coaches frequently assist members outside of California: http://icma.org/en/ca/programs/coaching
Scroll through the coaches gallery, and give one of them a call! (or send an email). Florida was also developing a coaching initiative at FCCMA, so you might reach out to them as well, though I'm not sure where that stands at the moment.

author: Robert Bentkofsky
text: Does ICMA provide assistance reviewing/developing resumes or does ICMA have any third party services that provide this service?
title: Resume Review/Technical Assistance
